column4: this n00b here is in badly need of help from some one that can help with instructions to apache/php/mysql setup
You're on the right track, but still missing some things...specificaly libapache2-mod-php5
I would not install ftp if all you want to do is work on MySQL.  I would install phpmyadmin which will allow you to work on MYSQL from any browser anywhere
one other thing...spelling my nick would be nice so that I can see that you are chatting directly with me
why do you want to install FTP?  For what purpose?
want to be abel to upload webpages from my main PC.

cool, now I can tell that you are speaking directly to me...If you want a secure and easy way to upload web pages from a windows pc to your ubuntu box I would look into installing WinSCP on windows and ssh server on ubuntu
let me do 1 thing at the time. im a old man, and my fuches burns over a litle easy, when it comes to Linux..
Have you installed libapache2-mod-php5 to get php5 to work with Apache2?
not yet.. im reading the guide you gave a link to...
is there a way that i can uninstall it all, so i can follow that guide right down to the dot?
You could probably just start from where you are at the moment and follow the guide
if i can figure out where that is :)

i just ran  sudo bin/mysql_install_db --user=mysql and now it sais that i have to copy some support-files/mysql.server to the right place. how adn where do i finde thoes?? (If that is something i need to do)
I don't know the answer to your question...sorry
that is oki.. i was just hoping. i figure that it aint that important.. going to next step
